item.title: Maxwell's Equations
Maxwell-Faraday Equation
item.description: The differential form of this particular one of Maxwell’s Equations. \nabla \times E = -\frac{\partial B}{\partial t} \mathcal{E} = \oint \vec{E} \cdot d \vec{l} = -\frac{d \Phi_{B}}{d t} = - \frac{d}{dt} \oiint_{S} \vec{B} \cdot d \vec{S} = - \oiint_{S} \frac{\partial B}{\partial t} \cdot d \vec{S} Also: Faraday’s Law.

item.title: Poynting Vector
item.description: \vec{S} is the Poynting vector, which corresponds to the direction of the electromagnetic wave or its power flow. \vec{S} = \frac{1}{\mu_{0}} \vec{E} \times \vec{B} Where I is intensity in \frac{W}{m^2} I = S_{avg} = \frac{E_{max}B_{max}}{2 \mu_{0}}= \frac{E_{max}^2}{2 \mu_{0}c} E = cB .

item.title: RL Series DC Circuit
item.description: Where \mathcal{E} is the EMF of the battery that charges the circuit. Growth i(t)=\frac{\mathcal{E}}{R}(1-e^{-\frac{R}{L}t}) Decay i(t)=\frac{\mathcal{E}}{R}e^{-\frac{R}{L}t}.

item.title: Solenoid
item.description: A wire loop with turns in it. You get a magnetic field through one when current goes through it such that B \propto I. B =\mu_0nI.

item.title: Speed of Light
item.description: c = \frac{1}{\sqrt{\mu_{0}\epsilon_0}} Derivation using Maxwell’s Equations todo.
